etymons.notes: ʕrǧ ‘lahm sein, lahmen, hinken, humpeln’ Wehr 826

Infectum.turoyo: gd-əṯyo emo d-aryo raġla qəṣto-yo ko-mhalxo ko-mʕaržo me-raġla
translations: ‘Then a mother lion shall come, her foot is swollen. She limps on her foot (while) she walks’ 75/283;

Infectum.turoyo: 29. I=bruske nayiḥo. Eló balé ṣaqaṭ yo. Ṣaqaṭ yo, komaʕrəǧ b ḥḏo raġlo.
translations: The pain receded. But he became lame, we was limping with one of his legs (Sultan_Nisane)
